anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch89407 [Saeki Yuuka] is a middle school student who often encounters people in need of help. One day, she helps a strange, round, squishy creature... which turns out to be an underground dweller named http://anidb.net/ch89406 [Chii-chan]! After helping him, the kind Yuuka brings Chii-chan home to live with her. This super cute comedy about the pre-chi-ous Chii-chan has begun! Source: crunchyroll

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: robot helper
tag.description: In a http://anidb.net/t2846 [science fiction] setting, the robot helper is, in a comedic sense, pretty much equivalent to what the "cute comic relief http://anidb.net/t1835 [animal sidekick]" is in a fantasy setting. The usually small machine has artificial intelligence, enabling it to support their owner / master with advice or help with menial tasks. http://anidb.net/t1278 [Androids] should not be considered robot helpers since these are far more complex; use the android tag instead.

tag.name: shoujo
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shoujo, literally meaning "girl", refers to a female audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: cooking
tag.description: Cooking is the process of preparing food by using heat.

tag.name: robot
tag.description: A robot is an automatically guided machine, able to do tasks on its own. Another common characteristic is that by its appearance or movements, a robot often conveys a sense that it has intent or agency of its own. Not to be confused with android (human-like robot).

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: space
tag.description: The final frontier.

tag.name: fictional location
tag.description: A fictional location is a place or world which is run by different set of rules than our common and ordinary world. This may include completely fictional worlds with no semblance of Earth, computer-generated worlds, fantasy worlds, magical worlds, parallel worlds accessible through portals, and so on. Or it may be fictional places like floating islands, dungeons or planets, which can co-exist with ordinary Earth, but are otherwise separate from it. A world that generally shares the characteristics of, and/or is generally indistinguishable from the real world (bar research on a "more than cursory" level), would NOT be considered a fictional world. A good example is http://anidb.net/a4521 [Code Geass]. It contains several real world nationalities, such as http://anidb.net/a4521 [China], http://anidb.net/t2672 [Japan] (now Area 11), http://anidb.net/t5091 [India], etc, along with fictional nationalities such as http://anidb.net/t2361 [Britannia]. China, Japan, and India are easily identified with a cursory look. The location is unmistakably the planet Earth, even though national borders have been redrawn. The fictional world should only be tagged if it plays a materially important role in the plot and setting; generally, an episodic occurrence of a fictional world should not be tagged. A fantasy world is a type of fictional world, part of a fictional universe. Typical worlds involve, but are not limited to: magic or magical abilities, and/or a medieval theme. Some examples include: a parallel world tenuously connected to Earth via magical portals or items; a fictional Earth-like planet in the remote past or future; or an entirely independent world set in another universe. Many fantasy worlds draw heavily on real world history, geography, and sociology, and also on folklore.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: countryside
tag.description: The anime takes place far from the any densely populated areas like cities, i.e. out in the suburbs, in the countryside with many fields and forests.

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: contemporary fantasy
tag.description: Contemporary fantasy, also known as modern fantasy or indigenous fantasy, is a sub-genre of fantasy, set in the present day. It is perhaps most popular for its sub-genre, urban fantasy. These terms are used to describe stories set in the putative real world (often referred to as consensus reality) in contemporary times, in which magic and magical creatures exist, either living in the interstices of our world or leaking over from alternate worlds. It thus has much in common with, and sometimes overlaps with secret history; a work of fantasy in which the magic could not remain secret or does not have any known relationship to known history would not fit into this subgenre. Occasionally certain contemporary fantasy novels will make reference to pop culture. Novels in which modern characters travel into alternate worlds, and all the magical action takes place there (except for the portal required to transport them), are not considered contemporary fantasy. Thus, C.S. Lewis`s The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe, where all fantasy events take place in the land of Narnia which is reached via a magic wardrobe, would not count as contemporary fantasy; on the other hand, the part of The Magician`s Nephew, where the Empress Jadis gets to London, tries to take over the Earth and clashes with police and a crowd of cockneys, would qualify as such. Contemporary fantasy is also to be distinguished from horror fiction, which also often has contemporary settings. When encountering magical events and creatures, the protagonist of a horror novel is horrified, while the protagonist of a fantasy novel (contemporary or otherwise) is filled with a sense of joy and wonder. Horrifying events may happen, but the fundamental distinction is vital. In his preface to That Hideous Strength, one of the earlier works falling within this sub-genre, C.S. Lewis explained why, when writing a tale about "magicians, devils, pantomime animals and planetary angels", he chose to start it with a detailed depiction of narrow-minded academic politics at a provincial English university and the schemes of crooked real estate developers: "I am following the traditional fairy-tale. We do not always notice its method, because the cottages, castles, woodcutters and petty kings with which a fairy tale opens have become for us as remote as the witches and ogres to which it proceeds. But they were not remote at all to the men who first made and enjoyed the tales". The same is true for many of the later works in the genre, which often begin with a seemingly normal scene of modern daily life to then disclose supernatural and magical beings and events hidden behind the scenes. Source: wiki

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: shipboard
tag.description: Beam me up, Scotty! Space stations (think Death Star) also count. Basically, this category is to tell if the setting takes place onboard a spaceship in space. This category is not applicable if the spaceship lies on a planet and never actually gets into space.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: volleyball
tag.description: Volleyball is a team sport in which two teams of six players are separated by a net. Each team tries to score points by grounding a ball on the other team`s court under organized rules. Use the http://anidb.net/t7147 [competitive beach volleyball] tag for competition or professional beach volleyball play. Use the http://anidb.net/t6478 [beach volleyball episode] tag when the beach volleyball game is a one-off event, such as during a beach or pool visit.

tag.name: dodgeball
tag.description: Dodgeball is any of a variety of games in which players try to hit other players on the opposing team with their own balls while avoiding being hit themselves. Don`t try this at home, kids.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Africa
tag.description: The world`s second-largest continent and the birthplace of the human species, Africa is a place of a huge diversity, with deserts and savannas, with famine and precious stones, with cultural and economical riches of all kinds. Throughout history, Africa has been the cradle of empires and has been ruled by foreign powers, and as of the early 21st century sees swift changes and economic boom going side by side with inhuman levels of poverty.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: henshin
tag.description: Japanese for "transformation" (metamorphosis or disguise). A "henshin anime" is any anime, where the characters or their costumes transform, such as Sailor Moon. The henshin switches on the character`s special powers, and is frequently accompanied by a costume change. Often the change of clothing is the only outward indicator that the character has changed and yet nobody seems to notice the hero`s true self. Most henshin heroes have a special item which they use to change into their heroic form. These items are usually activated by a command phrase (which is often in Engrish, for some reason), triggering a transformation sequence.

tag.name: under one roof
tag.description: For some reason or another, the main protagonist (e.g. male in harem / female in reverse-harem) is living together with many other characters of the opposite-gender, all under the same roof (in the same dwelling unit).

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: OP variety
tag.description: Several OP sequences in this anime have either a different song or different animation, maybe even to the point of having a unique OP for each episode.

tag.name: unidentified flying object
tag.description: An unidentified flying object, or UFO, is in its strictest definition any apparent object in the sky that is not identifiable as a known object or phenomenon. However, the term is widely used in popular culture to refer more specifically to supposed observations of craft of extraterrestrial origin. Most UFOs are later identified as conventional objects or phenomena (e.g., aircraft, weather balloons, clouds). Some of them are not identified, either because of lack of evidence or because no conventional explanation can be found despite extensive evidence. Some people consider the latter cases as possible observations of extraterrestrial space craft. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: underwater
tag.description: Underwater is a term describing the realm below the surface of water where the water exists in a natural feature such as an ocean, sea, lake, pond, or river.

tag.name: catastrophic gadgets
tag.description: Comedy element: One of the characters in the anime tends to "invent", "create", or "call into existence" all sorts of wacky gadgets. The intent is to help the other protagonists in some way. Only that this fails every single time, ending in a catastrophe.

tag.name: open-ended
tag.description: The ending of this anime is left to the viewer`s imagination. There are no clear hints at a definite story outcome, several possibilities are presented without closure, or the story ends suddenly without explanation. There may also be room for a sequel.

tag.name: table tennis
tag.description: Table tennis (also called ping pong) is a sport in which two or four players hit a lightweight ball back and forth using a table tennis racket. The game takes place on a hard table divided by a net. Except for the initial serve, players must allow a ball played toward them only one bounce on their side of the table and must return it so that it bounces on the opposite side. Points are scored when a player fails to return the ball within the rules. Play is fast and demands quick reactions. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: light-hearted
tag.description: Not being burdened by trouble, worry, or care; happy and carefree. Just a casual and feel-good watch.

tag.name: ocean
tag.description: The large bodies of salt water surrounding the continents and islands are a (significant) setting of this anime.

tag.name: winter
tag.description: Coldest season of the year with ice and snow, everything is covered in a blanket of white.

tag.name: ED variety
tag.description: Several ED sequences in this anime have either a different song or different animation, maybe even to the point of having a unique ED for each episode.

tag.name: heart-warming
tag.description: The story and its characters give off good vibes — includes elevated feelings of affection such as tenderness, sympathy and love, all in one package. The kind of anime which leaves you with a warm feeling inside and you can not stop smiling while watching it.

tag.name: watercolour style
tag.description: A watercolour or aquarelle is a painting method in which the paints are made of pigments suspended in a water-based solution. Some anime are created in the style of watercolour paintings, the watercolour style, usually with faded pastels that often give the show a warm and friendly visual presentation. In modern anime, this is generally achieved via computer effects that create an imitation of watercolour, rather than by creating real-life watercolour art. While the watercolour style is more commonly used for backgrounds, it is possible to create the entire anime in such a style.

tag.name: biting
tag.description: Some people seem to like biting others, especially when irritated. This may also be an aggression or self-defence mechanism. In anime, this will often lead to greatly enlarged mouths being able to bite someone else`s head, commonly for comedic effect.

tag.name: diet
tag.description: One or more of the characters in this anime go on a diet, to lose some weight. Typically a female character will be extremely distressed that her clothes no longer fit, or that her ideal weight has been exceeded. Ironically, normal growth is often the explanation. Since diets do not work, this ends up as a comedy element, with many ridiculous attempts to get slim quickly.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: season
tag.description: A season is a division of the year, marked by changes in weather, ecology, and hours of daylight. Seasons result from the yearly orbit of the Earth around the Sun and the tilt of the Earth`s rotational axis relative to the plane of the orbit. In temperate and polar regions, the seasons are marked by changes in the intensity of sunlight that reaches the Earth`s surface, variations of which may cause animals to go into hibernation or to migrate, and plants to be dormant. During May, June, and July, the northern hemisphere is exposed to more direct sunlight because the hemisphere faces the sun. The same is true of the southern hemisphere in November, December, and January. It is the tilt of the Earth that causes the Sun to be higher in the sky during the summer months which increases the solar flux. However, due to seasonal lag, June, July, and August are the hottest months in the northern hemisphere and December, January, and February are the hottest months in the southern hemisphere. In temperate and subpolar regions, four calendar-based seasons (with their adjectives) are generally recognized: spring (vernal), summer (estival), autumn (autumnal), fall and winter (hibernal). Ecologists often use a six-season model for temperate climate regions that includes pre-spring (prevernal) and late summer (serotinal) as distinct seasons along with the traditional four. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: ending
tag.description: This is a container tag to house meta-like tags relating to how endings of anime play out.

tag.name: half-length episodes
tag.description: Half-length episodes are regular episodes that are somewhat shorter than the standard length. This includes episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length; shows with episodes up to and including 10 minutes are http://anidb.net/t5852 [short episodes] instead.

tag.name: underground
tag.description: Some or all of the action occurs underground, in caves, mines, sewers, subways or underground cities.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: ドキドキ! おでかけは危険がいっぱいでち!
Thrilling! The Many Dangers of Going Out!
Dokidoki! Odekake wa Kiken ga Ippai Dechi!
episode.summary: Today the whole gang is going to the shopping center. Chi-chan and Uc-chan are thrilled to be seeing one for the first time! Chi-chan and Uc-chan part ways with Yuka inside, and just as the two of them are having a blast together... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ワクワク! ちぃちゃん学校へ行くでち!
Exciting! Chi-chan Goes to School!
Wakuwaku! Chii-chan Gakkou e Iku Dechi!
episode.summary: Chi-chan decides to accompany Yuka to school. He turns himself into a charm hanging from her bag so that no one will recognize him as an underground dweller! When they get to school, they find Yuka`s friend Ara-chan worrying about something... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: びっくり!? プリプリショットでち!
Surprise?! A Pripri Shot!
Bikkuri!? Puripuri Shot Dechi!
episode.summary: Chi-chan befriends Uc-chan, an alien that Yuka saved, and they both decide to repay Yuka for her kindness! So Uc-chan, who excels at inventing things, makes something for Chi-chan... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: プリプリ! ちぃちゃんがやってきたでち!
Pripri Chi-chan Is Here!
Puripuri! Chii-chan ga Yatte Kita Dechi!
episode.summary: Chi-chan the underground dweller has come from beneath the earth to taste the delicious sweets on the surface... but then he got stuck and couldn`t get back home. The one who arrived to help him was Yuka, a middle school girl who seems to frequently encounter people who need help. After being saved by Yuka, Chi-chan makes a decision! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: キラキラ! デコるの大好きのんちゃんですのん! でち!
Sparkle! I`m Non-chan, and I Love to Decorate, Non!
Kirakira! Dekoru no Daisuki Non-chan Desu non! Dechi!
episode.summary: The Bumbler Trio is working hard to repay their debts by picking up trash. As they`re walking, they find a hole in the dirt that leads underground, and poking out from the hole is... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハッピー! あかりちゃんの誕生日でち!
Happy! It`s Akari-chan`s Birthday!
Happy! Akari-chan no Tanjoubi Dechi!
episode.summary: Chi-chan, Uc-chan, and Joe-kun decide to go to school with Yuka again. While they`re there, one of Yuka`s schoolmates, a boy named Suo-kun, figures out what Chi-chan really is...! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: へっぽこ! ゆーかにいっぱい恩返しでち!
Bumblers! Gotta Do Lots to Repay Yuka!
Heppoko! Yuuka ni Ippai Ongaeshi Dechi!
episode.summary: Chi-chan, Uc-chan, and Joe-kun form a team to repay Yuka`s kindness together! They use the PriPri Shot to try to make Yuka happy. Can they succeed in repaying their debt to Yuka?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: じょじょ! ちぃちゃんを救うじょでち!
Jo, Jo! I`m Gonna Save Chi-chan, Jo!
Jojo! Chii-chan o Sukuu jo Dechi!
episode.summary: Joe-kun, an underground dweller, has come to the surface to rescue Chi-chan, who never returned home after coming above ground. He sneaks into Yuka`s house and begins his rescue mission! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: グラグラ! 地底へ里帰りでち!
Mole, Mole! Paying a Visit Underground!
Guragura! Chitei e Satogaeri Dechi!
episode.summary: Yuka agrees to go accompany the others on their visit to the underground. They all head there together to see the land where Chi-chan was born! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: でっぷり!? スリムになりたいでち!
Butterball?! I Want to Slim Down!
Deppuri!? Slim ni Naritai Dechi!
episode.summary: Chi-chan had decided to return to the underground for a visit, but he`s put on so much weight that he can`t fit through the hole! So the Bumbler Trio decides to try going on a diet... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヒヤヒヤ! ゆーかとママの仲良し大作戦でち!
Chills! The Plan to Help Yuka and Her Mom Get Along!
Hiyahiya! Yuuka to Mama no Nakayoshi Daisakusen Dechi!
episode.summary: The Bumbler Trio is concerned about Yuka`s awkward relationship with her mother, so they decide to reveal their existence to her mother and help the two get along better... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スヤスヤ... ゆーかの夢へおでかけでち!
Snooze... A Trip to Yuka`s Dream!
Suyasuya... Yuuka no Yume e Odekake Dechi!
episode.summary: The Bumbler Trio is worried that Yuka is under a lot of stress because of Chi-chan, so they enter her dream to try to help her work off her stress... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: サンサン! 夏の海をまんきつでち!
Shine! Enjoying the Sea in Summer!
Sansan! Natsu no Umi o Mankitsu Dechi!
episode.summary: To make the most of a hot summer, the gang invites Suo-kun and Akari-chan for a day at the beach! As they`re all playing in the ocean, Akari-chan loses her floatie. Chi-chan uses the PriPri Shot to try to order it, but what appears is... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゲキオコ! 家庭教師なんていらないっ! でち!
Outrage! I Don`t Need a Home Tutor!
Geki Oko! Kateikyoushi Nante Iranai! Dechi!
episode.summary: Yuka`s mom wants to have a boy who was Yuka`s childhood friend come over to be her tutor, but Yuka is against the idea, leading to an argument. Yuka seems to be acting much more adamant then usual. Then the boy in question drops by... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: パシャパシャ! 地底人記者の大スクープでち!
Snap, Snap! The Underground Reporter`s Big Scoop!
Pashapasha! Chiteijin Kisha no Dai Scoop Dechi!
episode.summary: As Chi-chan and friends are relaxing in Yuka`s room, they notice a strange figure taking pictures of them through the window. They open the window, and there stands Reporter-kun, a reporter for the underground magazine "Weekly Underground" who`s come to make an article about Chi-chan! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: じょじょじょ!? 赤ちゃんパニックでち!
Jo, Jo, Jo?! It`s a Baby Panic!
Jo Jo Jo!? Akachan Panic Dechi!
episode.summary: Yuka is worried because Joe-kun hasn`t come to visit lately. It turns out Joe-kun has been busy looking after his triplet siblings, so the other decide to help him out! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: もぎゅっ! フルーツ三人娘でち!
Mogyu! The Three Fruit Girls!
Mogyu! Fruits Sannin Musume Dechi!
episode.summary: Yuka is struggling with her art homework because she isn`t a good painter. She`s supposed to paint a picture of some fruit, but as Chi-chan is showing her some painting techniques, he eats all the fruit. So he tries to order some more fruit with the PriPri Shot... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ドタバタ! 温泉旅館でおおはしゃぎでち!?
Chaos! Running Wild at the Hot Spring Lodge?!
Dotabata! Onsen Ryoukan de Oohashagi Dechi!?
episode.summary: Doctor Hatena, an underground dweller summoned by Chi-chan`s PriPri Shot, joins the gang, and they finally arrive at the hot spring lodge! They spend the day enjoying the outdoor bath, table tennis, and more at the lodge, but then... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハテハテ? 家族旅行に出発でち!
What Could This Be? Setting Off on a Family Vacation!
Hatehate? Kazokuryokou ni Shuppatsu Dechi!
episode.summary: Chi-chan wants to go on a family vacation to make some summer memories, so Yuka`s mom suggests a trip to a hot spring in return for helping her around the house. They invite Non-chan, and the gang is off to the hot spring! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: まさか!? うっちゃんお別れでち!?
Could It Be?! Uc-chan Says Goodbye?!
Masaka!? Ucchan Owakare Dechi!?
episode.summary: Uc-chan reflects on the day she arrived on Earth, and her first meetings with Chi-chan and all the others. Sometimes she feels homesick for her home planet... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チテコレ! ファッションショーてこ! でち!
Under Colle! It`s a Fashion Show, Teko!
Chite Colle! Fashion Show Teko! Dechi!
episode.summary: The gang is going out, but Yuka and Uc-chan can`t decide what to wear. So Chi-chan tries to order something that`ll pick an outfit for them, but he ends up summoning the famous high-charisma fashion designer from the underground, Chiteko! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: がんばれ! えみちゃんは漫画家の卵でち!
Go for It! Emi-chan Is an Aspiring Manga Artist!
Ganbare! Emi-chan wa Mangaka no Tamago Dechi!
episode.summary: Emi-chan hopes to become a manga artist one day. She asks Yuka for opinions on the manga she`s working on, but Yuka isn`t sure what she should tell her. So Chi-chan uses the PriPri Shot to summon a manga professional to help... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: たいへん! ゆーかが夏バテでち!
Oh, No! Yuka`s Suffering from Summer Heat Fatigue!
Taihen! Yuuka ga Natsubate Dechi!
episode.summary: Yuka is suffering from fatigue caused by the summer heat, anf the Bumbler Trio is worried that it`s their fault. What plan will they come up with to make Yuka feel better? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゲキトツ! 恋のバトルで大騒ぎでち!?
Clash! Chaos Ensues in a Battle for Love?!
Gekitotsu! Koi no Battle de Oosawagi Dechi!?
episode.summary: Kazuma invites Yuka on a picnic to take a break from studying. Yuka isn`t into the idea at all at first, but Chi-chan says he wants to go to a flower park. So they also invite Suo-kun and Akari-chan along, and the whole gang sets off for a picnic! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: デチデチ! ロボチィチャンデチ! でち!
Dechi, Dechi! It`s Robo Chi-chan!
Dechi Dechi! Robo Chii-chan Dechi! Dechi!
episode.summary: Chi-chan is feeling down, so Yuka and the others try everything they can to bring him back to his cheerful self. Then, when they try using the PriPri Shot to order something that might help... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ショーゲキ! 山でアイツにそうぐうでち!
Shock! We Run Into You-Know-Who on the Mountain!
Shougeki! Yama de Aitsu ni Souguu Dechi!
episode.summary: Yuka`s class is having an extracurricular lesson today. Chi-chan and the gang joins her for a day gathering plants on Kappa Mountain. Suo-kun insists that there are kappas on Kappa Mountain, so they all go looking for one... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スポポポ! ゆーかのドッジボール特訓でち!
Spopopo! Yuka`s Intensive Dodgeball Training!
Supopopo! Yuuka no Dodgeball Tokkun Dechi!
episode.summary: Yuka is very worried after being placed in the dodgeball event, her least favorite, in her school`s upcoming ball sports meet. So the gang decides to try intensive training so that she`ll no longer be scared to play dodgeball! Chi-chan uses the PriPri Shot to order something for their training, and the result is... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: メヂカラ! 絵本の世界で大冒険でち!
Piercing Eyes! Adventure in a Picture Book World!
Mejikara! Ehon no Sekai de Daibouken Dechi!
episode.summary: Joe-kun arrives at Yuka`s house with a picture book. Chi-chan uses the PriPri Shot to order something that`ll allow them to read it together, and a giant pillow appears! So they try putting the book under the pillow and sleeping on it... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: プリちぃ! カワイイお部屋をつくるでち!
Pri-tty! Let`s Design a Cute Room!
Puri Chii! Kawaii Oheya o Tsukuru Dechi!
episode.summary: As he argues with Joe-kun over who should clean Yuka`s room, Chi-chan starts to wish he had a room of his own. So everyone decides to use the magic wands he ordered with the PriPri Shot to create a room for him! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ニンニン! パンツをとりもどせでち!
Nin, Nin! I Have to Get My Pants Back!
Ninnin! Pantsu o Torimodose Dechi!
episode.summary: With all the rainy weather lately, Chi-chan can`t dry his pants, and his last pair is blown away by the wind. He tries using the PriPri Shot to order something that`ll help him get his pants back... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スコココ! ピィちゃんお世話するでち!
Peck, Peck, Peck! Taking Care of Pii-chan!
Sukokoko! Pii-chan Osewa Suru Dechi!
episode.summary: Uc-chan has finished repairing her UFO, so she takes Chi-chan and Joe-kun for a ride... but with both of them on board, the UFO crashes into Pii-chan! The gang decides to look after Pii-chan until its injuries heal. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ウキウキ! ゆーかの誕生日でち!
Joy! It`s Yuka`s Birthday!
Ukiuki! Yuuka no Tanjoubi Dechi!
episode.summary: It`s Yuka`s birthday, so the Bumbler Trio has a meeting to decide what present they should give her. They decide to cook something tasty for her, so they order something with the PriPri Shot to help... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: さよなら!? ゆーかとお別れでち!? (後編)
Farewell?! Saying Goodbye to Yuka?! (Part 2)
Sayonara!? Yuuka to Owakare Dechi!? (Kouhen)
episode.summary: Chi-chan and the others tried to get back home to Yuka, but the opening to the surface has been covered up! Will Chi-chan, Joe-kun, and Uc-chan ever reunite with Yuka?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: さよなら!? ゆーかとお別れでち!? (前編)
Farewell?! Saying Goodbye to Yuka?! (Part 1)
Sayonara!? Yuuka to Owakare Dechi!? (Zenpen)
episode.summary: Chi-chan receives a letter from his father on the day before the Festival of the Stars, a major festival in his underground hometown. So Chi-chan, Joe-kun, and Uc-chan set off to the underground to see the festival, but then... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ウゴウゴ! 雪男とあそぶでち!
Ugo, Ugo! Playing with a Yeti!
Ugo Ugo! Yukiotoko to Asobu Dechi!
episode.summary: The gang looks outside one day to see the world covered in white! And so Chi-chan and company head out to play in the snow. They use the PriPri Shot to try to order a snow hut, and then... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ノリノリ! 歌のレッスンでち!
Singing Lessons! Move to the Music!
Norinori! Uta no Lesson Dechi!
episode.summary: Yuka has a singing test coming up tomorrow, so Chi-chan and the others decide to practice with her. They use the PriPri Shot to order something that might help, but what appears before them is... Source: crunchyroll
